testcase.name: Scenario: Display search results in 4 columns
Given I have searched for 'Yellow T-Shirt' on the Australian store
And I have some 'Yellow T-Shirt' displayed
When I refine my search by gender:'MEN' size:'S' and colour:'GREEN'
Then I should see the expected result:'MEN-S-GREEN'
| MEN | S | GREEN | MEN-S-GREEN |
Given I have searched for 'Yellow T-Shirt' on the Australian store
And I have some 'Yellow T-Shirt' displayed
When I refine my search by gender:'MEN' size:'M' and colour:'MULTI'
Then I should see the expected result:'MEN-M-MULTI'
| MEN | M | MULTI | MEN-M-MULTI |
Given I have searched for 'Yellow T-Shirt' on the Australian store
And I have some 'Yellow T-Shirt' displayed
When I refine my search by gender:'MEN' size:'L' and colour:'YELLOW'
Then I should see the expected result:'MEN-L-YELLOW'
| MEN | L | YELLOW | MEN-L-YELLOW |
Given I have searched for 'Yellow T-Shirt' on the Australian store
And I have some 'Yellow T-Shirt' displayed
When I refine my search by gender:'WOMEN' size:'AU4' and colour:'YELLOW'
Then I should see the expected result:'WOMEN-AU4-YELLOW'
| WOMEN | AU4 | YELLOW | WOMEN-AU4-YELLOW |
Given I have searched for 'Yellow T-Shirt' on the Australian store
And I have some 'Yellow T-Shirt' displayed
When I refine my search by gender:'WOMEN' size:'AU18' and colour:'YELLOW'
Then I should see the expected result:'WOMEN-AU18-YELLOW'
| WOMEN | AU18 | YELLOW | WOMEN-AU18-YELLOW |
